meanings.definition: To seize control of (a vehicle) by force
meanings.sent1: The criminals highjacked the bus and demanded money from the passengers.
meanings.sent2: The pirates highjacked the ship and sailed away with the treasure.
meanings.sent3: The kids highjacked the remote control and started a cartoon marathon.
meanings.sent4: The hacker highjacked the computer system and accessed confidential information.
meanings.sent5: The magician highjacked the audience's attention with a mesmerizing trick.

meanings.definition: To take control of (something) without permission or authorization
meanings.sent1: The thief highjacked the purse from the unsuspecting pedestrian.
meanings.sent2: The hacker highjacked the website and posted inappropriate content.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel highjacked the bird feeder and enjoyed a feast.
meanings.sent4: The toddler highjacked the conversation by babbling non-stop.
meanings.sent5: The student highjacked the class discussion with an unexpected question.
